description: Chevrolet Corvette C3 1982 Collector Edition

This is a 1982 Chevrolet Corvette C3 in driver's condition. Ofcourse the car has the original Collector Edition colour combination. The car drives, brakes and shifts gear and is a nice car for someone who wants to drive and wants to improve it himself.

1982 Chevrolet Corvette 1G1AY878XC5122422 for sale.

1982 Corvette T-Top Code 24/26 Two Tone Silver Blue, Dark Blue with perfect Dark Blue cloth interior. ONLY 3464 Original Miles! Options include Power Windows, Power Locks, Glass Tops, Cruise Control, AM-FM Radio with cassette, Aluminum Wheels with Original P225/70R15 white letter tires. Documented with the original owners manual, Build Sheet, and Window Sticker. The car still smells new!

1982 was the last year of the popular C3 ''stingray'' generation of Corvettes. Development was close to unveiling the C4, but then Chevy had to wait till the 1984 model year to roll it out. Some technology was already spilling out into these last C3's. 1982 saw the debut of the ''Cross-Fire Injection'' fuel delivery system. This TBI (Throttle Body Fuel Injection) was not the type of fuel injection installed previously in some C1 and C2 Corvettes. It utilized two throttle bodies combined with Chevrolet's computer control system. The transmission was reworked for better acceleration and lower RPM's for cruising in the top gear. The last of the stingrays were the most technologically advanced.

GR Auto Gallery is pleased to present this 1982 Chevrolet Corvette for consideration. This car looks like new featuring only 29,227 original miles. The current owner of this Corvette purchased it in May of 1994 from the one previous owner. The vehicle looks phenomenal in the silver exterior paint and pairs great with the dark blue cloth interior. The power plant in this Vette is the always reliable 350 cubic inch V8, and is paired with a 4 Speed Automatic transmission. Our test drive showed that this vehicle is not only great running, but shifts smoothly, brakes well, and handles great. Please call or email us for more information on this 1982 Chevrolet Corvette.
To see over 80 photos of this car, including under carriage please visit our website www.grautogallery.com

Gr Auto Gallery, LLC and our sister company, Wheelz Sales and Leasing Inc. makes every effort to represent each vehicle accurately and with integrity. We also welcome third party inspections when necessary. Although we try to do our very best to be accurate in our description writing we are human and do make mistakes. Unless otherwise noted, All vehicles are sold AS IS, No Warranty Expressed or Implied. All sales final.

1982 Chevrolet Corvette Collectors Edition. Finished in original Silver Beige Metallic Paint accented by none other than the original Multi Tone Silver Beige matching interior. Best of all the odometer is showing only 38,300 miles that are believed to be original to the car as per the owner.

This Collectors edition is powered by the correct L83 350Ci V8 engine with the troublesome Cross Fire fuel injection removed and a 4 barrel carburetor and new intake manifold are in its place for worry free cruising. The shifting is taken care of thanks to an all new for 82, 700R4 four speed automatic with overdrive making this a great car to take on the interstate.

The 1982 Collectors Edition was a real milestone in the Corvette world being the first to break the $20,000 price point, which was a large sum of money in the early 80's. It is also extremely well equipped and features power steering, power brakes, power windows, power drivers seat, factory air conditioning, tilt steering column, removable t top roof panels, hatch back opening rear window, leather interior, and correct Collectors Edition Wheels wrapped in radial tires.

Please call Velvet Hammer Motorcars at (941) 460-3168 and we will be happy to answer any questions you may have as well as shoot additional photos or videos upon request. All information provided is to the best of our knowledge and we are not responsible for typographical errors.

Very nice 1982 T-top coupe. Has crossfire 350, auto trans. all power options, mirrored tops, alum. wheels. Paint in good condition, and leather interior is very clean. Shows 29,000 miles. This is a low cost entry point to Corvette onwership ! Call for more details.

Best case scenario. It's a 19,746 mile survivor with top flight award. It is fully loaded and documented. It is red over red, best possible combo for a Vette. The down side to a low mile car can be things deteriorate with age. Well the current owner is as fussy as they get. He recently spent $8,187.84 servicing this car. He had things done that most people would have left alone. Everything from bushings, brakes and tune up to gaskets, fuel sender, a/c service and right done to underhood light. There is nothing left to do except enjoy, everything works! Documentation includes NCRS Top Flight certificate, judging sheets and plaque. Also has original window sticker, and GM verification. Also has several pieces of original literature- manuals, brochures, etc. Also has past and present maintenance records to verify miles and the work that has been done. A few recent upgrades like tinted windows and aluminum radiator have been made. The car is in beautiful condition. The original paint is still a very bright, glossy red.  Wheels are still brightly polished, tires are new. All the trim, rubber, glass, t-tops are excellent. Interior is obviously very well kept- dash, console area looks like new. It still has the original digital cassette stereo with CB. Motor compartment is very clean. There is nothing to apologize for on this Corvette!

Originally assembled on March 10, 1982 and with 45k documented original miles, this 1982 Corvette is the Black/Red color combination, has a clean Carfax, and is FULLY DOCUMENTED with records since new.
Runs very well. I've used her as a daily driver several times during the fall and spring seasons.
Code correct Black exterior, code correct Dark Red leather interior, both Astro t-tops and painted t-tops included.
Numbers matching 200hp 350ci Crossfire engine, 4 speed automatic overdrive transmission, posi rear-end.

Features include air conditioning, tilt-n-tele, power windows, power steering, power brakes, power antenna, rear defrost, AM/FM radio, dual rear speakers, cargo shade, roof panel carrier, slotted aluminum wheels.

Her paint is original on the body and is in good condition with new paint on the bumpers (original paint on the plastic was fading).  Clear acrylic Astro t-tops look to be newer, and are in good shape.  All glass shows a correct date code, including the windshield. A set of taillight louver covers are included. Exterior door handles are good-vg with no rubbing or major finish issues, and original weatherstripping is still soft in places. Slotted aluminum wheels show good-very good center caps, and Goodyear Eagle GT II raised white letter tires show nearly full tread depth remaining at an average of 8/32nds.

The interior of this 1982 Corvette has NEW leather seat covers and foam. Original steering wheel and shift plate are in good condition, and the dash is free of cracks and warping. Door panels are vg, and original carpet is good-vg. Gauges are vg with minimal fade and vg lenses. GM seatbelts are vg, the car has never been smoked in, and the car has always been garaged. Interior additions include a Custom Auto Sound AM/FM stereo with 3.5mm Headphone jack input, vintage dual front and rear Bose speakers, wood shift knob, Red shift boot, and a personalized ashtray plaque. Also included is a vintage Bose AM/FM/Cassette stereo. Clock is also working. T-top strap and two sets of t-top bags are included, as well as RARE complete factory roof panel carrier. Passenger's vanity mirror is intact.

The engine in this 1982 Corvette has the original casting date January 15, 1982, and final assembly date February 8, 1982. Correct Crossfire setup, radiator hoses, ignition shielding, valve covers, a/c compressor, and air pump are all in place, and the frame is solid and rust-free.

I have added SkyLink GPS which allows you to track the car in real-time from your phone or computer and set up "geo-fence" perimeter alerts to catch a thief (or your teenage son) as soon he moves the car. The fuel pump has been upgraded to a 1985 model as recommended for better throttle response. Custom dual-pipe exhaust with crimped pipe; exhaust produces a pleasant rumble without being too loud. Included  binder of documentation consists of original window sticker, build sheet, owner's manual, warranty info, 1982 Corvette brochure, 1982 Chevrolet full line brochure, various vintage photos of the car, manuals for the added Bose stereo system, and repair records and invoices dating back to March 1982. Price is negotiable.

Chevrolet Corvette C3 Targa 1982 Collector Edition, Crossfire injection

In the last production year of the Corvette C3, the Collector Edition was introduced. Only 6759 of this series were built. This is a rare Collector Edition, provided with the original Silver Beige (59) paint and special aluminium wheels. These wheels and paint were only delivered on the special edition. The original V8 Crossfire injection engine (L83) has 200 HP and is connected with the automatic gearbox. This car produces a typical American Sound. The Corvette is fabulous to drive and has a very easy to remove dual glass Targa roof. The beautiful interior has beige leather and the original dashboard in very good condition. This unique Chevrolet Corvette C3 is in very good condition and drives great.

The year is 1982 The worlds largest oil rig (The Ocean Ranger) sinks in the north Atlantic while this Bright Blue Metallic Corvette rolls into showrooms for sale. Now this two owner numbers matching Corvette only has 98917 actual miles on her. The interior was recently replaced with Light Camel leather and the Crossfire 350 V8 was recently tuned passing Emissions. The Chevrolet Corvette (C3) was a sports car that was produced by Chevrolet for the 1968 through 1982 model years. Engines and chassis components were mostly carried over from the previous generation but the body and interior were new. It set new sales records with 53807 produced for the 1979 model year. 1982 saw the debut of the "??Cross-Fire Injection"? fuel delivery system. This TBI (Throttle Body Fuel Injection) was not the type of fuel injection installed previously in some C1 and C2 Corvettes. It utilized two throttle bodies combined with Chevrolet"??s computer control system. The engine produced 200 HP and was mated to a new four-speed automatic transmission with torque converters bypass in the top three gears. Compared to the previous Turbo-Hydramatic 3-speed the new 700-R4 transmission had a lower first and second gear for improved low-end acceleration and a fourth gear overdrive that would reduce engine RPM by 30 percent at highway cruising speeds resulting in better fuel economy.To view the car in greater detail including 100+ HD pictures and a HD video please visit www.gatewayclassiccars.com or our Denver showroom. Call 303-872-4722 for more information.
1982 maked the end of the C3 Corvettes, and the first year for the Cross-Fire Injection system.

Someone had the foresight to keep one of those special Corvettes and limit it's use enough to show less than 27 000 miles today! A rare color (Code 13 - Silver), one of 711, it has matching Silver-Gray leather interior, and optional Glass roof panels. It is naturally in perfect shape and still shows the original factory markings under the hood on on the chassis.

C3 Corvettes are the next collectible ones, and this example of the last production year, with very low-mileage, is sure to appreciate in value, while bing a contender in Preservation- or Survivor-Class shows!

For over 40 years, John Scotti Automotive has been the reference in the field of exotic, vintage and collector cars in Montreal, Quebec and even across North America. Our exclusive inventory of classic cars has been the pride of our company for many years now. Our collection contains some of the most beautiful models of classics, including muscle cars and rare and one-off automobiles. We have Ford, Chevrolet, Plymouth, Cadillac, Mercedes, Pontiac and other makes of vehicles dating from the 1930s, 40s, 50s, 60s, 70s and 80s - one look at our inventory will inspire you to dream!

The John Scotti Automotive group is fortunate to be able to count on a team of devoted experts in vehicle restoration who are passionate about the history and mechanics of vehicles. Because of their expertise, we can offer an exceptional selection of classic automobiles which have undergone first-rate restoration. In fact, we are committed to preserving as much as possible the original appearance of our vintage automobiles.

If you're interested in one of our vehicles, then don't hesitate to contact us, by phone, toll-free, at 1-877-275-7434 to speak with a member of our team. To see our collection of automobiles, come down to 7905 Boulevard Provencher, in Saint-Leonard, Quebec, CANADA.

The John Scotti Automotive group is also renowned for its inventory of pre-owned luxury vehicles . Few dealerships in Canada can rightfully claim to offer such an exceptional selection of high-end sedans, SUVs and sports cars. This is your opportunity to acquire a superb pre-owned Ferrari, Mercedes, Lamborghini, Lotus, Bentley, Jaguar, Maserati, Aston-Martin or other fine makes at a very advantageous price.

We carry several highly sought-after Lamborghini, Ferrari and Lotus vehicles dating from the 70s, 80s and 90s, a large selection of luxury convertibles, European and Japanese models, and a number of rare and limited edition vehicles.
The great majority of our pre-owned luxury vehicles carry very low mileage, and all are in excellent aesthetic and mechanical condition. They await only a buyer!
Please see our complete inventory at: johnscotticlassiccars.com
Follow us on Facebook and Instagram: John Scotti Classic
